subject: p13291370
History: Right upper lobe pneumonia, with persistent tachypnea.
Findings: Comparison is made with prior study,. Moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly is stable. Pacer lead is in unchanged position. Main pulmonary arteries are enlarged as before. The right upper lobe pneumonic consolidation has improved as the opacities in the right lower lobe. Increasing opacities in the left lower lobe laterally are most likely consistent with atelectasis. There is no pneumothorax. There are small bilateral pleural effusions. Pulmonary edema has resolved.
